New Records: The Chicago White Sox set a modern major league record with their 121st loss.
Key Match Events: Jake Rogers scored when Jared Shuster was charged with a wild pitch even though the ball didn't hit the dirt just below catcher Korey Lee's glove.
Greene put Detroit ahead 3-1 with a double in the seventh, and Chicago helped the home team's cause again later in the inning when Fraser Ellard threw the team's third wild pitch of the night.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers started strong, winning six of their first seven games. They had a winning record until mid-May, when the team started to slide in the standings.
Post-Match Reflections: Hinch got creative, rolling with a rotation of Skubal and rookie Keider Montero while relying on the bullpen to pitch entire games such as the series opener against the White Sox in front of 44,435 fans at Comerica Park.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Detroit Tigers earned an AL wild card berth on Friday night, ending a decade-long postseason drought.
The Tigers have been on a tear, winning six straight and 10 of 11 to surge into the playoffs and eliminate the defending AL Central champion Minnesota Twins from the race.

Since Aug. 11, when Detroit was eight games under.500 and counted out of contention, it has been the hottest team in the majors with 31 wins in 42 games with the lowest ERA in baseball and the largest run differential.
Others: The Motor City's baseball team salvaged the season and revived interest, drawing big crowds after closing recent seasons in a mostly empty ballpark.
